metadata.title: CVE-2020-15436 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in fs/block_dev.c in the Linux kernel before5.8 allows local users to gain privileges or cause a denial of service byleveraging improper access to a certain error field.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49~18.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-45.49~18.04.2').
